Legal_Issue: Whether the respondent met the residency requirement under s. 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Procedural_Context: Appeal under s. 14(5) of the Citizenship Act and s. 21 of the Federal Courts Act
Credibility_Assessment: Respondent provided conflicting information about absences
Basis_of_Claim: Failure to meet physical presence requirement due to unreported travel
Evidence_Ignored: Potential significance of passport evidence suggesting undisclosed trips
Legal_Standard: Sufficient justification required for residency determination despite inconsistencies
Application_Factor: Residency duration and accuracy of disclosure
Decision_Outcome: Citizenship granted initially, then set aside on appeal
Authority: Citizenship Judge, Federal Court on appeal
Decision_Review_Issue: Lack of explanation resolving credibility concerns
Cause_of_Refusal: Inconsistent reporting of absences and potential misrepresentation
Legal_Provision_Cited: s. 5(1)(c), s. 14(5) of the Citizenship Act; s. 21 of the Federal Courts Act
Evidentiary_Issues: Conflicting statements about absences, passport indicating unreported travel
Document_Fraud: No explicit fraud, but misleading use of passport information
Credibility_Issues: Respondent's credibility undermined by inconsistent disclosures
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Respondent did not challenge reasonableness standard
Procedural_Issue: Failure to justify decision in light of contradictory evidence
